column2: The Coming Enlightenment
This anonymous writing is said to have greatly disturbed Neuhumanist theologians at the time of its publishing. It is still highly regarded nonetheless.
Crumbs of an Enlightened work
While some pages are missing and others too damaged to be readable, the intact fragments of Saint-Kierkegaard's thought are horribly depressing.
Tractatus Explicatio
This book, while horribly dense and almost unreadable, seems to be quite prestigious to own, judging by the hosts' reaction upon seeing it.
The Spiritual Contract
This short but rather intense writing could very well be the cause of profound religious troubles if it was to be found in the wrong hands, one better try to hide it...
A Treatises on Ethics
This antediluvian work of theological thought is sometimes hard to understand by modern scholars, yet its content is of great wisdom.
Old World Nuclearist Relic
This mysterious instrument is said to have been used to discover the many mysteries Monad holds, and is as such highly regarded : however, it is difficult to tell if one might make it work again...
Mysterious Medical Instrument
This oddy shapped object will make a wonderful impression during official receptions. Its real use, however, has yet to be proved.
The Holy Crown of Saint Stephen

The ancient crown often referred to as the Holy Crown of Saint Stephen, which has been the most important piece of regalia of the monarchs of Hungary for centuries, and which is the most sacred relic for the Coronite faithful.
Lehel's Horn
An ancient ivory horn, once used by the legendary hero Lehel, who murdered Duke Konrad of Lorraine with a single smite of it.
Imperial Laurel Wreath
This golden wreath is a symbol of wise and victorious Europa. It is said that Emperor Friedrich was crowned with it by the Muses when he had declared the creation of the empire.
Crown of Swabia

Forged out of an antediluvian predecessor, this Crown has been used to crown most swabian Kings since the times of King Hannes. A diamond-covered cross on its front, the giant opal gemstone below, this crown is a symbol of ancient splendour and might.
Globus Cruciger Bauariae
This cross and orb are an integral part of the Bavarian royal insignia since it was rediscovered by Felix I Theologicus. It is the only known insignia item of his remaining.
Amber Diadem
This diadem is the symbol of Baltic Imperial Authority. Amber of all sizes and shades decorate this artefact, some of them even having tiny animals enclosed in them.
The Holy Crown of Albion
The Holy Crown of Albion

The Crown was said to have been given by God Almighty to those worthy to sit the throne of Albion and now that a Monarch now once more sits on the throne of Albion, they are worthy to wear this splendid crown.
Steel Crown of Romania
This unique crown, first worn by King Carol I of the Romanians, was forged from the steel of an Ottoman cannon captured during the country's war of independence.
Lloyds Bank coprolite
The massive, fossilized "remains" of a great warrior, said to hold special significance to the history of all Britain. In its own way, it's as irreplaceable as the Crown Jewels.
Decorative Chess Set
A magnificient set of chess with fine engravings, delicate figurines and billions of possible different games to play.
Rubik's Cube
A very rare, working pre-event Rubik's Cube, only the smartest of minds can solve one.
Nebra Disk
A bronze plate, maybe even as old as time itself, depicting the Sun, the Moon, and the night sky's stars.
